text_126.en: A Floating Action Button (FAB) in mobile UI design is a prominent, circular button that hovers above the content, typically used for a primary action in an application. In Material Design, FABs provide a visually distinctive and accessible means to trigger key actions, promoting a clean and focused user interface.

text_129.en: Add a floating action button into your app using the `addFAB` method like this:

text_136.en: If you want the fab to position relative to the layout and not on the bottom right corner, pass a `Static` option.

text_137.en: If fab is `Extended` pass a text argument.

text_139.en: Here are the available setters and/or getters of the FloatingActionButton Component.

text_185.en: Here are the available methods for the Floating Action Button.

text_187.en: Adds a callback handler when the FAB is touch.

text_191.en: Sets the corner radius of the button.

text_32.en: Adds a callback function on right click.

text_41.en: Sets the size of the component.

text_58.en: Sets the x and y scaling of the component.

text_63.en: Returns the position of the component. The return object is of the form `{left, top, right, bottom}`

text_68.en: Sets the margin of the component.

text_76.en: Sets the padding of the component's container.

text_84.en: Sets the position of the component relative to its parent dimensions.

text_90.en: Sets the border line for the component container.

text_99.en: Sets the corner radius of the component.

text_107.en: Bring this component forward by a given z-index.

text_111.en: Bring this component backward by a given z-index.
